page.title: 12MIDDLETON TRADITIONS TODAY
page.content: {Morris Dancing-}It was often associated with the rushcart processions during{Middleton}wakes holiday on the 22nd of August. { {Pace Egging-}Easter Monday is the day of the traditional Pace Egging play revived by{Mike Harding}some years ago. The play is about the battle between good and evil and rising from the dead. The characters are{St {George,Slasher,The Doctor,Beelzebub {and the Turkish Champion.}Pace Egging had not been performed for 200 years until 1968. { {Bell Ringing-}there were only three practice peals allowed to each band, they weren't allowed to practice on Sundays. Started in 1643 during Cromwell's Commonwealth. {Whit Walks-}On Whit Sunday people walk through the town with their Parish Church. New clothes are worn.
